title: Accounting Manager
company: The Seattle School of Theology & Psychology
description:
**Reports to:** Vice President of Administration


**Department:** Business Office


**FLSA Category:** Non\-Exempt/Hourly


**Average Hours per Week:** 40


**Summary**
-----------


The Accounting Manager is responsible for the daily accounting operations, as well as monthly financial reporting, and annual budget and audit cycles, in consultation with a fractional CFO. We’re seeking a detail\-oriented and mission\-aligned accounting professional ready to take the next step in their career. This position offers significant responsibility and visibility in a small, collaborative environment where you’ll be a trusted partner to senior leadership. If you’re looking to grow beyond senior accountant roles and gain broader financial management experience, this position provides an excellent pathway for professional development.


**This role is ideal for you if you value:**


* Direct partnership with senior leadership
* Broad exposure to all aspects of nonprofit financial management
* Opportunity to lead key processes (financial close and reporting, budgeting, audit)
* Flexibility to balance professional growth with personal priorities
* Mission\-driven work with tangible impact
* Hybrid, flexible schedule: 1\-2 days per week on campus required

**Essential Functions**
-----------------------


The Accounting Manager is responsible for:


*Financial Operations \& Reporting*


* Manage day to day accounting operations including AP/AR and monthly payroll processing
* Manage student billing, including financial aid coordination and customer payments
* Maintain accounting records in accordance with GAAP, and prepare monthly and annual financial statements and reports for management and external agencies and partners (Department of Education, accreditors, grantors,)
* Manage treasury including daily cash balances, short term cash flow planning, and reporting liquidity impacts on KPIs
* Oversee month\-end and year\-end close processes, including CSV imports, accounts and subsystem reconciliations.
* Administer accounting technology, maintain chart of accounts and segments to ensure accurate coding of transactions


*Audit \& Compliance*


* Serve as primary contact with external auditors for financial statement audit, compliance audit, and 990 preparation
* Prepare audit schedules and supporting documentation
* Ensure compliance with federal and state regulations, including DoE financial aid regulations, and supporting Form 990 preparation,
* Maintain internal controls and documentation
* Manage grant accounting and reporting requirements (if applicable)


*Budgeting \& Analysis*


* Support annual budgeting process, working with President and department heads
* Monitor budget\-to\-actual variances and provide regular reporting
* Assist with cash flow forecasting and management of DoE composite score and other financial performance metrics
* Track restricted funds activity


*Strategic Support \& Process Improvement*


* Present financial reports to leadership
* Identify opportunities for process improvements and increased efficiency
* Manage banking relationships and accounting vendor contracts (Netsuite, Brex, etc.)
* Support special projects and institutional planning as needed
* Implement and optimize accounting systems and workflows

**Knowledge, Skills \& Abilities**
----------------------------------


*No candidate will possess every quality and the successful candidate will possess many of them. We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every qualification.*


*Required***:**


* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
* 5\-7 years of progressive accounting/finance experience, with at least 3 years full general ledger responsibility, with at least 2 years nonprofit accounting experience
* Strong knowledge of GAAP and financial statement preparation including reporting release from restrictions and net assets
* Experience with full\-cycle accounting and month\-end close
* Proficiency in ERP accounting software (Netsuite, or similar) and advanced Excel skills structuring and managing data
* Payroll experience required, with preference given to Paylocity experience
* Attention to details and awareness of how precision translates to system interactions. Ability to work in detail, but understand the impact to the whole and work collaboratively with budget managers and leadership
* Demonstrated ability to work and problem solve in a multi\-tasking environment
* Appreciation for and alignment with The Seattle School mission and Statement of Faith


*Preferred* *(Not Required – We’ll Help You Develop These):*


* Higher education experience
* Prior audit coordination experience
* Experience with grant accounting and compliance
* Interest in working toward CPA
* Familiarity with Populi, Thinkific or Asana software a plus

**Compensation \& Benefits**
----------------------------


The Seattle School of Theology \& Psychology provides a competitive total compensation package (salary, benefits, time off and more), aligned with the Seattle nonprofit market. The pay range for this position is $34\.00 – $40\.00 per hour). For this full\-time position we offer generous paid time off, retirement benefits, a bus pass subsidy, tuition assistance benefits, medical, dental, life, and long\-term disability insurance and a Health Savings Account. We also offer a flexible, supportive environment with colleagues committed to a common mission. Hours and schedule are negotiable, and can be done in a combination of remote and on campus hours.


**Application Process**
-----------------------


To apply please submit your resume, cover letter and completed Employment Application (Statement of Faith included) to jobs@theseattleschool.edu. The posting will remain open until filled, with preference given to applications received by Monday, February 9, 2026\.




**About the Employer**
----------------------


Established in 1997, The Seattle School of Theology \& Psychology is an interdisciplinary graduate school committed to training people to be competent in the study of text, soul, and culture to serve God and neighbor through transforming relationships. We enact our mission through our various training programs in our graduate school, Allender Center, and Center for Transforming Engagement. Employees at The Seattle School strive to hold the capacity to see relationally and to allow room for the complexity and nuance needed as the global body of Christ


*Federal employment non\-discrimination rules preserve the freedom of faith\-based organizations to hire according to faith. State and local employment civil rights laws include a similar exemption for faith\-based organizations such as The Seattle School of Theology \& Psychology.*

title: Fractional Controller
description:
**About Us** 

Founded in 2018, Menlo Education Research (MenloEDU) is an independent research firm supporting equitable learning through innovative design work and rigorous empirical research. We are a dynamic team of researchers, committed to improving learning opportunities for all youth.

MenloEDU maintains strong relationships with a network of researchers, practitioners, and specialists, contracting with them on a project\-specific basis. Together with our permanent staff, we work on projects that bring together communities of practice committed to addressing shared challenges.

Our work attends to the impact of local context through studies of implementation interventions drawing on partnership\-based research methods. We are also deeply involved with the field of educational assessment and measurement, catalyzing conversations around transforming systems to better support learning for each and every student.

Mirroring our commitments to education and learning, MenloEDU is dedicated to building a diverse and equitable workplace. We actively seek to recruit, develop, and retain talented individuals from all backgrounds. Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion is essential to achieving our mission.

**The Role** 

MenloEDU has grown to the point where our accounting needs are more complex, and we require a part\-time Controller to oversee the operations of the Accounting department in partnership with our fractional CFO. This role manages our part\-time Bookkeeper and the accounting functions managed by other staff, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, general ledger, bank reconciliations, and financial analysis.

This role plays a critical part in ensuring the financial health and compliance of MenloEDU’s research initiatives. We’re looking for someone who is both self\-driven and a great collaborator \- if that’s you, we want to talk!

This is a part\-time, fully remote position. We anticipate 10\-15 hours per month to start, and are open to working with consultants or employees.

**Responsibilities** 

* Oversee all of the company’s accounting practices
* Direct financial strategy, planning and forecasts in partnership with the fractional CFO
* Manage deferred revenue, grants/contracts accounting, project profitability, and project cash burn rates
* Create, coordinate, and evaluate the financial programs and supporting information systems of the company to include budgeting, tax planning, internal control, and conservation of assets
* Approve and coordinate changes and improvements in automated financial and management information systems for the company
* Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal reporting requirements
* Oversee the approval and processing of revenue, expenditure, and position control documents, department budgets, ledger, and account maintenance and data entry
* Coordinate the preparation of financial statements, financial reports, special analyses, and information reports
* Maintain and develop finance, accounting, billing, and auditing procedures and safeguards
* Work with CEO and fractional CFO, providing consultative support to planning initiatives through financial and management information analyses, reports, and recommendations
* Ensure records systems are maintained in accordance with accounting principles and auditing standards
* Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local legal requirements by studying existing and new legislation, anticipating future legislation, enforcing adherence to requirements, filing financial reports, and advising management on needed actions
* Manage all staff on the Accounting team

**Qualifications** 

* 3\+ years of Controller experience overseeing a company’s entire Accounting function
* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, or Engineering field required; MBA, CPA, or CMA preferred
* Advanced proficiency in Excel and QuickBooks
* Collaborative and communicative, with the ability to provide the meanings behind the numbers and track where information originated
* Experience with a grants\-funded organization; we are a for\-profit organization that is entirely grants\-funded, so a background in non\-profits would translate well

Job Type: Part\-time

Pay: $130\.00 \- $160\.00 per hour

Expected hours: 2 – 4 per week

Work Location: Remote

Luxury Hospitality Development \| Denver, CO (Hybrid / Remote\-Friendly)

We are developing a high\-end, design\-forward Japanese restaurant concept in the Denver area and are seeking an experienced Fractional Chief Financial Officer (CFO) to support financial governance, capital allocation, and investor confidence during development and buildout.

This is a **senior, part\-time, contract role** designed for an experienced finance professional who excels in capital\-intensive projects and prefers focused, high\-impact engagements.

**Role Overview:**

The Fractional CFO will serve as a strategic financial partner to the founding team and lead investors, ensuring disciplined use of capital, transparent financial reporting, and proactive planning throughout design, permitting, construction, and pre\-opening phases.

This role is **not day\-to\-day accounting or bookkeeping**. It is a governance and oversight position focused on protecting capital and enabling informed, timely decision\-making.

Time Commitment \& Compensation

* **Hours:** 4–6 hours per week (approximately 16–24 hours per month)
* **Pay:** $150–$200 per hour, based on experience
* **Engagement Type:** Contract / Fractional / Part\-Time
* **Schedule:** Flexible; remote\-friendly with occasional Denver\-based meetings

*Optional benefits may be available depending on engagement structure.*

**Key Responsibilities:**

Capital Allocation \& Financial Controls

* Establish and maintain a clear uses\-of\-funds framework
* Monitor burn rate, runway, and milestone\-based capital deployment
* Review and approve major expenditures against approved budgets

Financial Modeling \& Analysis

* Maintain and update project pro formas
* Model lease structures (gross vs. net), buildout scenarios, and sensitivities
* Support break\-even analysis and downside risk planning

Investor Reporting \& Communication

* Prepare concise monthly or quarterly financial updates
* Support investor diligence and financial transparency
* Serve as a trusted financial point of contact for the investor group

Development \& Buildout Oversight

* Review GC budgets, estimates, and draw schedules
* Coordinate with developers, landlords, and consultants on financial matters
* Identify financial risks early and recommend mitigation strategies

Governance \& Risk Management

* Review major contracts (lease, GC, and design agreements)
* Support insurance review, entity structure, and financial controls
* Ensure capital is deployed strictly for approved purposes

What This Role Is Not

* Bookkeeping, payroll, or transactional accounting
* Creative, culinary, or operational decision\-making
* A full\-time executive position

**Ideal Candidate Profile:**

Experience

* Prior experience as a Fractional or Project\-Based CFO or in a senior financial leadership role
* Background in hospitality, restaurant groups, real estate, or development\-oriented businesses
* Experience working directly with founders and investors in early\-stage or growth environments

Education

* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, Economics, or a related field required
* MBA or advanced degree preferred

Licenses \& Certifications

* CPA, CFA, CMA, or similar professional certifications preferred but not required

**Why This Opportunity:**

* Flagship, design\-driven hospitality project
* Strong investor backing and experienced founding team
* Opportunity to establish financial discipline from the ground up
* Flexible, high\-impact role with potential for longer\-term advisory involvement

Expected hours: 4 – 6 per week

Our mission is to help businesses make smarter financial decisions by offering a full suite of services, including bookkeeping, tax preparation, and CFO advisory. At Indinero, we believe in fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and client\-centricity. We're committed to delivering exceptional value to our clients while creating a dynamic and rewarding environment for our team members. As we continue to grow and evolve, we seek passionate professionals who share our vision of transforming how businesses manage their finances. Join us in making financial clarity accessible to every ambitious company.

 **Job Summary:** The Fractional CFO provides strategic financial leadership and advisory services to our clients, helping them drive growth, improve profitability, and strengthen financial operations. This role also plays a critical part in supporting the growth and development of the CFO practice within the firm. The Fractional CFO collaborates closely with client leadership, internal Controllers, and other CFOs to ensure consistent service delivery, effective reporting, and the highest level of client satisfaction. Exceptional communication skills, strategic thinking, and a proactive approach to problem\-solving are essential to success in this role.

	+ Mentoring and upskilling other CFOs within the firm.

	+ Contributing to the development and standardization of service delivery models.

* Actively participate in internal initiatives aimed at enhancing operational efficiency, team collaboration, and knowledge sharing across the practice.


**Required Job Skills:**


* Proven experience as a CFO or senior finance executive, ideally in advisory, consulting, or growth\-stage business environments.
* Strong strategic thinking, problem\-solving, and analytical skills.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex financial concepts clearly to diverse audiences.
* Collaborative mindset, with experience working cross\-functionally to drive results.
* Ability to mentor, coach, and upskill other finance professionals and seek personal growth opportunities.
* Comfortable managing multiple client engagements and priorities in a fast\-paced environment.
* Demonstrated ability to standardize processes, improve reporting, and enhance overall service quality.
* Business development acumen, including supporting client acquisition and upsell initiatives.

* Ability to multi\-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively.

description:
**Join the Rapidly Growing Team at Attivo Partners!**



Are you dedicated to excellence and eager to advance your career? Passionate about technology and startups? Excited to work with some of the most innovative early\-stage companies in the world? If so, Attivo Partners is the place for you!


**Why Attivo?**



Attivo Partners is a fast\-growing full\-service finance and accounting consulting firm headquartered in San Francisco, with a presence in major startup hubs across the US. Our remote teams specialize in providing fractional CFO and accounting services to venture\-backed emerging growth clients, supporting their journey from inception to over $50M in revenue.


**What We Offer:**


* **Collaborative Environment:** Work alongside a talented team with extensive experience in venture\-backed companies. At Attivo, we believe in teamwork and value the unique insights and creativity each member brings.
* **Culture of Growth:** We thrive on the challenges presented by diverse and exciting clients, offering unparalleled learning and professional development opportunities.
* **Mentorship and Training:** We are committed to nurturing talent and providing ongoing mentoring and training to help you grow personally and professionally.
* **Flexibility:** We understand the importance of balance and are dedicated to maintaining a culture that supports your career and personal life.


**Our Values:**


* **Lasting Relationships:** We build solid and enduring connections with our clients and team members.
* **Data\-Driven Insights:** We leverage data to drive intelligent decisions and impactful results.
* **Growth\-Focused Mindset:** We embrace opportunities for continuous improvement and innovation.
* **Collaboration\-First:** We prioritize teamwork and believe the best solutions come from working together.
* **Culture\-Conscious:** We foster a supportive and inclusive culture where everyone can thrive.


Join us at Attivo Partners and be part of a team that's shaping the future of finance and accounting for startups. Let's grow together!



**Engagement Overview**



We are seeking a senior\-level Interim or Fractional Controller to step in on an hourly, contract basis to stabilize, clean up, and redesign our internal accounting function for a fast\-growing organization. This engagement is hands\-on and execution\-focused, requiring ownership of day\-to\-day accounting operations while simultaneously building the future\-state Controller role.



The consultant will operate as the internal Controller until a permanent hire is made. The primary objective is to establish scalable, well\-documented processes and controls, create a comprehensive accounting playbook, and ensure a seamless transition to a full\-time Controller at the conclusion of the engagement.


**Scope of Work \& Key Objectives**


* Stabilize and own day\-to\-day accounting operations during the interim period
* Clean up historical accounting issues and modernize existing processes
* Design and document the ideal Controller operating model for a high\-growth company
* Build scalable policies, procedures, and internal controls
* Create a detailed accounting playbook to support long\-term ownership
* Support the hiring and onboarding of a permanent internal Controller


**Responsibilities**


* Fully own and operate the internal accounting function on an interim basis, including day\-to\-day execution
* Manage and oversee two Staff Accountants responsible for Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable
* Serve as the primary accounting partner to the CFO, translating transactional activity into clear financial insights
* Lead accounting cleanup initiatives, including reconciliations, close inefficiencies, and reporting accuracy
* Design, implement, and document scalable accounting policies, procedures, and internal controls
* Personally execute and test new processes to ensure successful implementation prior to team handoff
* Manage all general accounting activities, including full\-cycle month\-end close, journal entries, reconciliations, consolidations, and variance analysis
* Prepare monthly financial statements and management reporting, including budget vs. actual and fluctuation analysis
* Direct billing, collections, cash management, and cash forecasting activities
* Oversee payroll processing, sales commission calculations, and tax compliance
* Build standardized KPI dashboards and recurring leadership reporting
* Create standardized and ad\-hoc financial reports covering revenue, margins, operating costs, and key performance metrics
* Develop budgeting, forecasting, and cash flow processes in partnership with leadership
* Create and document a comprehensive accounting playbook, including SOPs, calendars, controls, templates, and role definitions
* Define the future\-state Controller role and assist with recruiting, interviewing, and onboarding the permanent hire


**Ideal Consultant Profile**


* Former or current Controller with experience in interim, fractional, or consulting roles
* Proven success rebuilding or scaling accounting functions in high\-growth environments
* Comfortable owning day\-to\-day accounting while designing future\-state processes
* Strong change management skills with the ability to bring structure to evolving organizations
* Experienced people manager, capable of leading small accounting teams
* Executive\-level communicator with the ability to partner closely with CFOs and leadership teams


**Preferred Background**


* Experience supporting startups or scaling companies (approximately 100–200 employees)
* Prior ownership of accounting cleanup or post\-growth restructuring initiatives
* Experience building accounting playbooks and SOPs for long\-term use
* Familiarity with QuickBooks Online, Bill.com, Rippling, and Monday.com
* Professional services industry experience a plus


**Engagement Details**


* Hourly, contract\-based engagement
* Duration: Until permanent Controller hire is completed and onboarded
* High degree of autonomy and ownership expected

  


**Reports To:** Internal CFO
  

**Hiring Range:** $125\-$145 per hour \- based on experience
**Position Status:** 1099 \- temporary, 20\+ hours per week

  



Attivo Partners will never request payment, sensitive personal information, or unsolicited account access at any stage of the hiring process. All legitimate communication from our team will come \*exclusively from an @attivopartners.com email address. If you receive a message claiming to be from Attivo that does not use this domain \- or if something feels unfamiliar \- please disregard the communication and report it to us at Recruiting@Attivopartners.com.

**Le Dental Spa** is a boutique, patient\-first dental practice that blends comprehensive dentistry with facial esthetics and wellness\-focused care. Beyond delivering exceptional clinical outcomes, we operate with an elevated, hospitality\-driven approach and a strong focus on intentional growth.

As a multi\-service practice, our business includes a mix of clinical care, esthetic services, and long\-term patient relationships, making thoughtful financial strategy, clear systems, and sustainable operations essential. This role supports the financial foundation that allows our team to deliver high\-quality care while continuing to grow in a smart, balanced way.

**Job Summary:**

We are seeking a **Fractional Chief Financial Officer (CFO)** who wants to partner closely with the practice owner and the leadership team in supporting the financial health of the practice, the strength of the business, and the sustainability of our team.

This role is relationship\-driven and collaborative by nature. The ideal candidate values long\-term partnership, takes the time to understand how the business truly operates, and is committed to providing thoughtful, high\-quality financial leadership. You’ll be responsible for bringing clarity to cash flow, profitability, and financial decision\-making while maintaining the highest standards of professionalism, accuracy, and strategic thinking.

This is not a bookkeeping role. It’s a hands\-on, strategic partnership focused on financial clarity, accountability, and building a strong financial foundation that supports exceptional patient care and long\-term growth.

**Our Core Values**

At Le Dental Spa, our values epitomize our unwavering commitment to invigorating and energizing the experience. We infuse every aspect of our practice with our values: to be informed, innovative, and have integrity. We want to breath new life into the industry and the well\-being of our patients.

***Informed***

*Our commitment to being informed drives us to provide the highest quality care, fostering a harmonious and supportive environment for our patients.*

***Innovative***

*Our commitment to be innovative means continually seeking the latest knowledge, techniques, and technology in dental and esthetic care.*

***Integrity***

*Our dedication to Integrity ensures that we operate with honesty, transparency, and ethical practices, fostering trust and confidence in our services.*

Le Dental Spa transcends being just a typical dental practice; it becomes a vibrant and revitalizing oasis where our vital values converge, illuminating a path towards dental and esthetic excellence, redefining the standard of care in the industry.

**Responsibilities:**

* Partner with founder and leadership to support the financial health of the practice.
* Provide strategic insight into cash flow, profitability, and financial performance.
* Review financial data and summarize key trends and recommendations.
* Support oversight of accounts receivable and payment processes.
* Help establish and maintain clear financial processes and controls.
* Collaborate with operations and admin to align finances with daily workflows.
* Review expenses and vendors to identify efficiency opportunities.
* Assist with budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning.
* Maintain professionalism, discretion, and financial integrity.
* Stay current on best practices relevant to healthcare and service\-based businesses.

**Qualifications:**

* Experience in a finance or financial leadership role (CFO, Fractional CFO, Controller, or similar).
* Strong understanding of cash flow, profitability, and financial planning.
* Strategic, relationship\-driven approach to financial leadership.
* Clear communication skills with the ability to explain financial concepts simply.
* Strong attention to detail with a big\-picture mindset.
* Ability to work independently while collaborating closely with leadership.
* Organized, proactive, and comfortable managing priorities across the business.
* Familiarity with service\-based or healthcare businesses preferred

If you are a finance professional who values clarity, integrity, collaboration, and long\-term growth and you’re passionate about helping a patient\-first practice operate sustainably and confidently, we would love to hear from you.

Please submit your resume and a brief note introducing yourself and your relevant experience. We’re excited to connect.

title: Head of Marketing
description:
**Reports to:** CEO.  

Works closely with: Fractional CMO (transition \+ strategic support), Sales Leadership, PR Agency, Podcast Team, External Consultants, VP of Operations.  

Manages: Marketing Manager, Content Marketing Specialist, Marketing Assistant, and external partners (SEO/PPC, web dev, CRM/RevOps, Graphic Design, etc.).  

**About TeamBonding:**  

TeamBonding is a leading corporate team building company that helps organizations create human connections through purposeful play, offering in\-person, virtual, and charitable experiences nationwide.  

Our marketing team is responsible for driving qualified demand, strengthening our brand, and helping sales teams convert interest into booked programs.  

**Role Overview:**  

The Head of Marketing is a hands\-on strategic leader responsible for owning demand generation and brand growth. This role will bring the fractional CMO function fully in\-house: setting strategy, leading a high\-performing marketing team, and executing integrated campaigns across paid, owned, and earned channels. The Head of Marketing will partner tightly with sales to drive lead acquisition, improve conversion, and support revenue growth while ensuring all marketing aligns with TeamBonding’s brand voice, core messaging, and seasonal business cycles.  

This is a “player\-coach” role: you will lead, prioritize, and also roll up your sleeves to get work done.  

**Key Responsibilities:****Strategy, Planning \& Leadership:*** Own the marketing strategy and quarterly planning process, aligning priorities to company goals, seasonality, and pipeline needs.
* Lead and guide the marketing team, ensuring clear priorities, timelines, and accountability.
* Work directly with the CEO and cross\-functional partners (Sales, PR agency, podcast team, operations, and external consultants).
* Provide creative direction and strategy across campaigns, including trade shows, program launches, press initiatives, advertising, video content, and new marketing initiatives.
* Establish an AI\-enabled marketing approach (tools, guidelines, and workflows) to increase speed and consistency while protecting TeamBonding’s brand voice, accuracy, and IP.
* Ensure all marketing efforts align with TeamBonding’s brand voice, core messaging, and positioning across all channels.

 **Budget Ownership \& Vendor Management:*** Own and manage the marketing budget, including planning, forecasting, pacing, and ROI evaluation.
* Allocate spend across channels and initiatives (paid media, SEO, web development, tools/software, contractors/agencies, trade shows, creative production).
* Manage external agencies and consultants: scope, contracts, deliverables, timelines, and performance.
* Regularly report budget performance and marketing ROI to leadership.

 **Demand Generation \& Pipeline Growth:*** Develop, implement, and optimize demand generation programs across paid, owned, and earned channels (email, web, social, paid media).
* Partner closely with Sales to align pipeline\-building efforts, improve lead quality, and strengthen conversion.
* Build and optimize lead journeys: acquisition nurture MQL/SQL pipeline contribution.
* Create campaign briefs, messaging, and measurable success metrics for each initiative.
* Use AI\-assisted experimentation to accelerate campaign iteration (messaging variants, creative testing, audience hypotheses) and improve conversion across channels.

 **Website, SEO \& Conversion Optimization:*** Oversee SEO strategy and performance, ensuring optimization of new and existing program pages and adherence to best practices.
* Own website roadmap and priorities (new pages, integrations, CRO improvements), ensuring quality control and alignment with brand messaging.
* Partner with the Marketing Manager to manage website updates, troubleshooting, and ongoing optimizations.
* Collaborate cross\-functionally on program launches by overseeing the creation of launch messaging and web needs (landing pages, program pages, assets), ensuring on\-time delivery and brand consistency.
* Leverage AI to support SEO content refreshes, internal linking opportunities, and CRO testing ideas, ensuring human review and brand/quality standards before publishing.

 **Marketing Operations, Analytics \& Technology (HubSpot \+ Salesforce):*** Own the marketing ops strategy and performance standards across HubSpot \+ Salesforce (attribution, lead stages, lifecycle definitions, data hygiene, reporting).
* Oversee HubSpot execution (email marketing, nurturing, segmentation, automations, monthly newsletter), led day\-to\-day by the Marketing Manager.
* Manage relationships and priorities with Salesforce/HubSpot consultants to improve integration, workflows, automation, and long\-term optimization.
* Define KPI dashboards and reporting cadence; ensure the team delivers actionable insights from Google Analytics, HubSpot, Salesforce, and tools like Hotjar.
* Use performance insights to guide channel strategy, budget allocation, and quarterly planning.

 **Content, Creative \& Brand Stewardship:*** Oversee content strategy across blog, LinkedIn newsletters, case studies, landing pages, and sales enablement.
* Direct the graphic designer in creating and coordinating print and digital materials aligned with seasonal campaigns.
* Maintain best practices for asset management (organized storage, version control, tracking of edits/uploads).
* Leverage AI to support SEO content refreshes, internal linking opportunities, and CRO testing ideas, ensuring human review and brand/quality standards before publishing.

 **Podcast, PR \& Brand Initiatives:*** Oversee the Team Building Podcast strategy and performance, ensuring topics, guests, and episode launches align with quarterly campaigns, brand messaging, and demand generation goals.
* Partner with the Marketing Manager (day\-to\-day lead) on podcast planning, guest pipeline support, production timelines, launch execution, and distribution via Podbean and the website.
* Collaborate with the PR agency on press initiatives and integrated promotional campaigns; ensure messaging consistency and strong cross\-channel amplification.
* Oversee video and brand storytelling initiatives (concepting direction, campaign alignment, and measurement), while delegating day\-to\-day production coordination to the Marketing Manager and/or external partners.

 **Trade Shows \& Field Marketing:*** Set trade show and field marketing strategy in partnership with Sales: setting goals, themes, positioning, and success metrics for each event.
* Partner with the Marketing Manager (day\-to\-day lead) to coordinate execution: marketing materials, branding assets, booth collateral, landing pages, and pre\-/during\-/post\-show promotions.
* Oversee post\-event follow\-up strategy and messaging; ensure the Marketing Manager builds and optimizes follow\-up campaigns for attendees and hot leads in HubSpot.
* Ensure booth messaging, landing pages, and campaign tie\-ins are aligned to pipeline creation, and that performance is tracked and reported (leads captured, conversion rates, influenced pipeline).

 **Competitive Intelligence \& Market Awareness:**  

Stay actively aware of competitors and trends; apply learnings to improve positioning, messaging, and channel strategy.  

**Team \& Management Scope:*** This role will oversee and develop:
* Marketing Manager.
* Content Marketing Specialist.
* Marketing Assistant.
* External agencies/consultants: SEO, PPC, web development, PR, and RevOps/CRM, Graphic Design, Social Media.

 **Success Metrics (What “Good” Looks Like):*** Increased qualified lead volume and improved lead\-to\-opportunity conversion.
* Increased marketing\-sourced and marketing\-influenced pipeline.
* Improved revenue outcomes tied to marketing efforts (marketing\-sourced bookings/revenue, influenced revenue, CAC/LTV where applicable).
* Stronger attribution and ROI clarity by channel and campaign.
* Improved website performance (traffic quality, conversion rates, landing page effectiveness).
* SEO growth for high\-intent program pages and seasonal content.
* Higher email engagement and improved nurture performance.
* Cleaner HubSpot/Salesforce workflows, reporting, and automation.
* On\-time, high\-quality campaign execution and consistent brand voice.

 **Qualifications:**  

**Required:*** 10\+ years of B2B marketing experience with 5\+ years leading a team (player\-coach experience preferred).
* Proven success owning demand generation and pipeline\-building in a B2B environment (services, events, HR/talent, or adjacent industries a plus).
* Strong understanding of SEO, content strategy, email marketing, and website/CMS management.
* Hands\-on experience with marketing automation and CRM platforms (HubSpot strongly preferred; Salesforce is a major plus).
* Strong analytical skills: ability to interpret data, find insights, and improve performance.
* Excellent project management and ability to prioritize in a fast\-moving environment.
* Strong writing, editing, and messaging skills, can maintain brand voice across channels.
* Practical experience using AI tools to improve marketing efficiency and performance (content development, SEO/CRO, analytics), with strong judgment around accuracy, privacy, and brand standards.

 **Preferred:*** Experience marketing high\-consideration, consultative services.
* Experience with PR, podcast growth, and trade show/field marketing.
* Familiarity with tools like GA4, Hotjar, Looker Studio, SEO tools (Ahrefs/SEMrush), and paid media platforms.

 **Working Style \& Values Fit:*** Action\-oriented, organized, and comfortable owning outcomes end\-to\-end.
* Collaborative partner to Sales and Operations; clear communicator with leadership.
* Creative thinker who can also execute the details.
* Strong brand instinct and commitment to consistent voice and messaging.
* Excited by “purpose\-driven” work, team building, and human connection.

RDI operates a high complexity CLIA / CAP laboratory supporting clinical trials across the United States. Our reputation is built on medical credibility, regulatory integrity, and trust. This role offers the opportunity to contribute to meaningful, high impact diagnostics research without the demands of a full time operational position. Your expertise matters here, and your judgment carries real weight.

RDI helps diagnostic and medical device companies achieve FDA clearance faster by running clinical trials with speed, precision, and accountability. We focus exclusively on diagnostics and medical devices, areas that have long been underserved in clinical research.

RDI is an overnight success years in the making.

description:
**Job Title:** **Fractional Head of Business Development****(AI for subsurface intelligence)**

**Location:** Remote (preference for U.S. Southwest relationships). Travel for key in\-person meetings/conferences as needed.

**Engagement:** Fractional/part\-time, contract role (1099\) with potential to expand scope and engagement (please read job description thoroughly for compensation offering details)

**Overview**: Support Business Development of SaaS and consulting work related to subsurface characterization, including geothermal and critical mineral prospecting

**Start:** ASAP

**Company Overview**

*EnviTrace LLC is a science‑driven AI/ML technology company specializing in environmental, energy, and earth‑science applications. Our subsidiary PurpleEarth™ is revolutionizing mineral exploration with AI\-driven subsurface intelligence—helping companies drill smarter, faster, and with higher confidence.*

*We develop advanced, science‑informed machine‑learning tools and cloud\-based software that help clients analyze complex geologic and environmental data for use in geothermal exploration, geologic reservoir management, carbon sequestration, water and contaminant remediation, and other sustainability‑critical tasks. Founded in 2021 and based in Santa Fe, New Mexico, EnviTrace serves a growing market that intersects clean energy, environmental stewardship, and data\-driven decision\-making.*

**Role Overview**

EnviTrace and its subsidiary PurpleEarth are developing AI\-driven subsurface intelligence to improve mineral exploration decision\-making, enabling faster targeting, more efficient programs, and better probability\-weighted investment choices. The Fractional Head of Business Development will provide senior commercial leadership, drive early market engagement, advance customer relationships, and convert technical interest into paid pilots and commercial contracts. This role combines relationship\-driven business development with disciplined execution, requiring close collaboration with technical, operations, and administrative teams to deliver compliant, repeatable revenue growth.

**Key Responsibilities**

***Go\-to\-market \& Sales Execution***

* Responsibility to own and drive early\-stage commercial strategy by defining target customers, prioritizing segments, and building a qualified pipeline.
* Leverage your business and partner network to secure warm introductions and meetings with key decision\-makers across exploration, technical services, innovation, and executive leadership.
* Advance discovery calls into NDAs, MOUs, SOWs, data access agreements, pilot definitions, pricing discussions, and aligned procurement paths.
* Collaborate with the technical team to design pilots; scope, timelines, success metrics, and results interpretation to support go/no\-go decisions.
* Develop pitch decks for our technologies
* Propose efficient go\-to\-market strategies
* Drive opportunities to close, delivering paid pilots, evaluations, and recurring commercial contracts.

***Partnerships \& Channel Strategy***

* Build and grow revenue\-generating relationships with service firms, data providers, and consultancies to expand market reach.
* Develop and execute partner models (ex: referral agreements, co\-sales, jointly delivered paid pilots) to generate near\-term revenue and create a scalable opportunity pipeline.

***Messaging \& Market Insight***

* Position offerings to resonate with both technical experts and business decision\-makers, emphasizing revenue\-driving value.
* Turn customer and market feedback into actionable insights that inform product strategy and drive paid pilots and scalable adoption.

***Operational Discipline***

* Maintain a disciplined CRM and sales pipeline with weekly updates on stage, subsequent actions, blockers, and close probability.
* Develop repeatable commercial templates (discovery scripts, interview questionnaires, pitch decks, pilot SOWs, pricing frameworks, follow\-up sequences) to accelerate revenue and go\-to\-market strategies.
* Work closely with EnviTrace’s Management and Development teams to ensure all customer engagements, pilots, vendor relationships, and subcontracting comply with external funding, grant, and procurement requirements.

**What Success Looks Like (First 90 Days)**

* **First 30 Days:**
* Deliver an agreed ICP and target list (50–100 priority organizations) with a clear commercialization outreach plan.
* Schedule 10–20 qualified meetings with key customers.
* Produce a PurpleEarth commercial toolkit: discovery questions, pilot offerings, and pricing framework.
* **By Day 60:**
* Advance 3–5 opportunities to pilot scoping, with defined data requirements and success metrics.
* Secure 1–2 LOIs or written pilot commitments, even if procurement timelines extend.
* **By Day 90:**
* Close at least 1 paid pilot or equivalent paid evaluation and maintain 2–3 additional late\-stage opportunities in the pipeline.
* Establish a clear understanding of sales cycle realities: budgets, procurement timing, decision criteria, and expansion potential.

**Who You Are**

**Required**

* 10\+ years in mining or geoengineering leadership experience (or equivalent senior credibility in the industry).
* Experience working within regulated or externally funded environments (e.g., government grants, public funding, or compliance\-driven contracts).
* Track record of selling technical offerings to conservative buyers.
* Strong network across exploration teams and geoengineering organizations (critical minerals mining expertise is a plus).
* Comfortable with ambiguity and early\-stage environments.
* Can communicate clearly to non\-technical stakeholders and technical evaluators.
* Self\-motivated and proactive problem\-solver with an entrepreneurial mindset.

**Strongly Preferred**

* Experience marketing and selling software/data/AI/analytics, geophysics, geology services, or decision\-support tools.
* Familiarity with geoengineering exploration workflows and data types (geology, geochem, geophysics, remote sensing, drill data).
* Experience in structuring pilots that convert into larger rollouts.

**Time Commitment**

This role starts at 10–20 hours per week with a flexible schedule, offering the opportunity to expand as business development traction grows. Occasional travel will be required to attend high\-value meetings and targeted conferences, enabling direct engagement with key customers and partners.

**Compensation**

We are early\-stage and flexible. Compensation will be documented in a written consulting agreement and may include one or more of the following:

* **Contract retainer** (monthly or hourly) tied to a defined scope and weekly cadence.
* **Performance\-based cash incentives** for paid pilots/contracts you directly source and close (terms and crediting defined up front).
* **Equity\-based compensation may be considered** for services under a written agreement with clear deliverables and vesting; it is not available in all jurisdictions and is not a substitute for cash compensation.

**How To Apply**

This is a senior\-level, high\-impact recruiting role responsible for sourcing, engaging, and hiring experienced entrepreneurs, CEOs, and senior operators to join Scaling.com as Strategists. Success in this role requires strong communication skills, sound judgment, and a thoughtful, proactive approach to talent acquisition. You will serve as both a brand ambassador and a trusted advisor to candidates, ensuring alignment between their experience, mindset, and our Strategist role.

* Help build one of the strongest entrepreneur Scaling platforms in the world.
* Work directly with elite former founders and operators.
* High autonomy and ownership over a mission\-critical function.
* Meaningful impact on thousands of entrepreneurs scaling their businesses.

Scaling.com is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity of experience, background, and perspective—especially among those who have built and scaled companies in different ways.

description:
### **SALARY: $30\-$40/hour based on experience for 15\-25 hours/week**


### **About Us**


The CAM Collective (TCC) is a national network of best\-in\-class, independently operated community management companies. We partner with strong local firms to help them grow, modernize, and scale while preserving the people, culture, and community\-first values that make each company unique. Our team is high\-growth and small\-but\-mighty, built for people who are proactive, collaborative, and deeply committed to quality. We move with intention, think strategically, and take ownership of our work, creating an environment where smart ideas are valued, and individuals have real impact.


### **Role Overview**


We are seeking a part\-time Marketing Manager to support our M\&A team across brand positioning, outbound communications, and deal\-related marketing initiatives. This role blends strategy and execution; ideal for a self\-directed marketer who is comfortable working closely with senior leadership and adapting quickly to evolving priorities.


The role is part\-time and flexible, with workload scaling around active deal flow.


### **Key Responsibilities**


**M\&A Marketing \& Deal Support**


* Develop and maintain marketing materials that support acquisition efforts (one\-pagers, pitch decks, company overviews, landing pages).
* Collaborate with the M\&A team to articulate value propositions tailored to founders, sellers, and brokers.
* Support rebranding or transition communications for newly acquired companies, as needed.


**Brand \& Content**


* Ensure consistent messaging and visual identity across all M\&A\-related materials.
* Draft and refine written content, including outreach messaging, internal announcements, and light thought leadership.
* Partner with internal or external designers, copywriters, and agencies when appropriate.


**Digital \& Campaign Support**


* Assist with campaign planning and execution (email, LinkedIn, website updates).
* Track basic performance metrics and recommend optimizations.
* Maintain and update M\&A\-related content on websites or internal platforms.


**Cross\-Functional Collaboration**


* Work closely with executive leadership, operations, and portfolio company teams.
* Manage multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines.
* Bring structure and clarity to marketing requests tied to active deals.


### **Qualifications**


* 1\-3 years of experience in marketing, communications, or brand management.
* Experience supporting M\&A, private equity, professional services, or B2B organizations strongly preferred.
* Strong written communication skills with an eye for clarity, tone, and audience.
* Comfortable working in a fast\-paced, high\-trust environment with limited oversight.
* Proficient with common marketing tools (Google Workspace, PowerPoint/Keynote, Canva or Adobe tools, basic CRM or email platforms).
* Ability to balance strategic thinking with hands\-on execution.


### **Nice to Have**


* Experience marketing to founders or owner\-operators.
* Familiarity with property management, real estate, or services\-based businesses.
* Prior work in a fractional or consulting capacity.


### **Why This Role**


* Direct exposure to executive leadership and high\-impact initiatives.
* Flexible, part\-time structure with room to grow as the platform scales.
